alert.note: Alert for Fillmore (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 04 at 11:02PM CDT until July 05 at 3:15AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM CDT WEDNESDAY FOR CENTRAL FILLMORE COUNTY... At 1102 PM CDT, emergency management reported flash flooding in Shickley. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Geneva, Shickley and Strang. This includes the following streams and drainages... Indian Creek, North Fork Turkey Creek, Dry Sandy Creek, Turkey Creek, Big Sandy Creek, Elk Run Creek and South Fork Turkey Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
